content:
Hi all. I've been digging around a bit in the literature and discovered this 1974 conference on "Computation and Control". Maybe the first ACT meeting?
https://www.springer.com/us/book/9783540071426

I haven't had a chance to look it over yet---Springer doesn't even provide the abstracts---but I've requested some of the articles through my library.

Obviously the computation part kept growing, but as far as I can tell the control aspects lapsed until ~2005, when Haghverdi, Tabuada & Pappas applied bisimulation to controlled dynamical systems. I found this referenced in Ames' 2006 thesis on hybrid systems. Is anyone aware of work in this area during the intervening 30 years?
Just to warn people who might be reading: this book has been stolen by the ignoble people who run libgen.li. Please don't download it from there! Wait for Springer.

Jules Hedges said:

YOU WOULDN'T DOWNLOAD A PROCEEDINGS

That ad was hilarious. "YOU WOULDN'T DOWNLOAD A CAR" You bet I would if only I could!
